title.narrative: Action Aid: Stärkande av förändringsaktörer Myanmar 2015-2017
Action Aid:Empowering people for change Myanmar 2015-2017

description.narrative: Support to a young felowship program, where young people are selected for an extensive training, with the aim of contributing to change in their locla context

The overall objective of the intervention is to: Contribute to the fulfilment of human rights through consolidation of peace, democracy and development in Myanmar.The specific objective is: Empowering people for change, by strengthening marginalised groups, cvil society, media and government to reduce poverty, improve governance and promote human rights.The 5 outcomes are:1) Governance insitutions, community and media are strengthened in order to establish pro poor governance and accountability and to respond to the needs of the poor and excluded people;2) Women able to lead organised and formulate/ advocate policies, practices and mechanisms to live free of fear, violence and become economically independent;3) Young peope able lead as change makers, driving peace, democracy and development i Myanmar;4) The quality of public education for the children in Myanmar is improved through active policy engagements, promoting citizen's participation and capacity development, initiating advocacy for increased financing for education and for access & inclusion;5) Vulnerable people, especially women, in rural communities developed sustainable income through improved access to and control over natural resource and capital, alternative livelihood practices, and built community resilience to withstand disasters.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The examples of the results that have been achieved, both expected and unexpcted, are: AAM have continued to work with local authorities with bottom up planning and pro-poorbudgeting and decentralised planning. AAM is working with 19 organizations to promote and work with active citizenship and accountable governance. 62 parliamentarian committees’ members at union, state/region levels are trained on planning and budgeting through the facilitation of advocacy workshop and seminars. Conducting two high level policy dialogues on social economic development in Myanmar and another two-policy dialogue on media development. Lifting up the bottom-up planning process to township level in 7 townships across Ayeyarwaddy, Mandalay and Magwe Region, and Kayah and Kayin State. Launching Safe Cities campaign with 500 guests, parliament representatives, organization representatives, AAM staffs, partner staffs, assorted media and community members in attendance. The event welcomed a number of notable speakers including the Yangon Chief Minister, who made a speech endorsing women’s rights and safety in Myanmar. Women’s Urban Forum was conducted at the 7 target townships in Yangon. It invited community members, paralegals, township administrators, police, government representatives and AAM staff, to discuss women’s safety regarding transportation, street lighting, sexual harassment and how to build responsive public services. 60 paralegals received refresher training on psychosocial support. 730 cases were reported to the Legal Clinic Myanmar, out of which 8 cases were taken to court. Gender has been in the forefront of AAMs work both externally as well as internally; wherea system of paralegal, fellows and self-help groups now have a model for addressing and assisting women victims of abuse. Several research on gender responsive budgeting has been undertaken which has been presented and discussed with government. The Village Books have extracted and analyzed specifically women's needs to be used for better and gender sensitive planning. 709 Fellows, 965 Activistas and 1516 Volunteers have been trained and are now actively engaged in 13 states and regions across MM. 330 Self Help Groups have been formed, assisting communities with alternative livelihoodand credit building activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
